raw_text:
{
  "base_id": "base_pregnancy_meds_0165",
  "assessment": "Patient is a 35-44 year old individual with hypothyroidism managed on levothyroxine 75mcg daily and taking a prenatal vitamin daily. Current lab values show TSH at 2.1 mIU/L, which is within the normal range indicating adequate thyroid hormone replacement. Creatinine is 0.9 mg/dL, within normal limits, and blood pressure is 118 mmHg systolic, which is also within normal range. No allergies reported and patient is not pregnant at this time.",
  "recommendations": [
    "Continue current levothyroxine dose with regular monitoring of TSH every 6-12 months or as clinically indicated.",
    "Maintain prenatal vitamin supplementation as part of general health maintenance.",
    "Monitor thyroid function tests if pregnancy occurs or if symptoms suggest altered thyroid status.",
    "Follow-up with primary care or endocrinology as appropriate."
  ],
  "clinical_notes": "No immediate changes indicated. Current management appears appropriate with stable labs and vitals."
}
